description: Description including instruction, contact information, administrative information, schedule and termination of contract, sync criterion etc
duration_in_months: . FROM CONTRACT START DATE TO 31 MARCH 2023
full_summary:
### Tender Announcement for Crab Winch Refurbishment Project

#### Project Overview

The Government of Canada, represented by Parks Canada, is seeking a contractor to refurbish crab winches at the Trent-Severn Waterway, Ontario Waterways. The project involves refurbishing five sets of crab winches, totaling ten winches.

#### Background Information

The procurement process for this project is being conducted in accordance with the Trade Agreements and Regulations set forth by the Government of Canada. The contractor is expected to have expertise in welding, sandblasting, levels, bench, carpentry, and machinism services.

#### Key Project Details

- **Project Title**: Crab Winch Refurbishment Project, Trent-Severn Waterway
- **Reference Number**: PW-22-01004022
- **Solicitation Number**: 5P300-22-0061/A
- **Publication Date**: August 11, 2022
- **Tender Closing Date**: September 7, 2022 14:00:00
- **Contact Information**:
  - **Contact Name**: Julie Dicaire
  - **Contact Email**: julie.dicaire@pc.gc.ca
  - **Contact Phone**: 873-355-3506

#### Tender Requirements and Submission Guidelines

- Bids will be accepted via fax and email only. Documents may be submitted in either English or French.
- A site visit will be held on August 23, 2022. Participants must confirm their attendance and provide names of attendees by August 22, 2022.
- The contractor is expected to maintain a level of quality that meets the guidelines set forth by the National Parks Regulations.

#### Additional Information

- The contractor must abide by the terms and conditions set forth in the contract.
- The Government of Canada retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
- Documents may be obtained from the Government Electronic Tendering Service at www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders.

#### Trade Agreements and Certification

This project adheres to Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, and Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA). Bidders must comply with these regulations.

The Government of Canada expects all contractors to participate constructively during the procurement process. All inquiries must be presented in writing to the Contracting Authority at least five days before the bid closing
